segment.source: When you set a policy to require Microsoft Passport in the workplace, you will want to prepare people in your organization by explaining how to use Passport.
segment.target: When you set a policy to require Microsoft Passport in the workplace, you will want to prepare people in your organization by explaining how to use Passport.

segment.source: After enrollment in Passport, users should use their gesture (such as a PIN or fingerprint) for access to corporate resources.
segment.target: After enrollment in Passport, users should use their gesture (such as a PIN or fingerprint) for access to corporate resources.

segment.source: Their gesture is only valid on the enrolled device.
segment.target: Their gesture is only valid on the enrolled device.

segment.source: Although the organization may require users to change their Active Directory or Azure Active Directory (AD) account password at regular intervals, changes to their passwords have no effect on Passport.
segment.target: Although the organization may require users to change their Active Directory or Azure Active Directory (AD) account password at regular intervals, changes to their passwords have no effect on Passport.

segment.source: People who are currently using virtual smart cards for authentication can use their virtual smart card to verify their identity when they set up Passport.
segment.target: People who are currently using virtual smart cards for authentication can use their virtual smart card to verify their identity when they set up Passport.

segment.source: On devices owned by the organization
segment.target: On devices owned by the organization

segment.source: When someone sets up a new device, they are prompted to choose who owns the device.
segment.target: When someone sets up a new device, they are prompted to choose who owns the device.

segment.source: For corporate devices, they select This device belongs to my organization.
segment.target: For corporate devices, they select This device belongs to my organization.

segment.source: who owns this pc
segment.target: who owns this pc

segment.source: Next, they select a way to connect.
segment.target: Next, they select a way to connect.

segment.source: Tell the people in your enterprise which option they should pick here.
segment.target: Tell the people in your enterprise which option they should pick here.

segment.source: choose how you'll connect
segment.target: choose how you'll connect

segment.source: They sign in, and are then asked to verify their identity.
segment.target: They sign in, and are then asked to verify their identity.

segment.source: People have options to choose from, such as a text message, phone call, or authentication app.
segment.target: People have options to choose from, such as a text message, phone call, or authentication app.

segment.source: After verification, they create their PIN.
segment.target: After verification, they create their PIN.

segment.source: The Create a work PIN screen displays any complexity requirements that you have set, such as minimum length.
segment.target: The Create a work PIN screen displays any complexity requirements that you have set, such as minimum length.

segment.source: After Passport is set up, people use their PIN to unlock the device, and that will automatically log them on.
segment.target: After Passport is set up, people use their PIN to unlock the device, and that will automatically log them on.

segment.source: On personal devices
segment.target: On personal devices

segment.source: People who want to access work resources on their personal devices can add a work or school account in SettingsAccountsWork or school, and then sign in with work credentials.
segment.target: People who want to access work resources on their personal devices can add a work or school account in SettingsAccountsWork or school, and then sign in with work credentials.

segment.source: The person selects the method for receiving the verification code, such as text message or email.
segment.target: The person selects the method for receiving the verification code, such as text message or email.

segment.source: The verification code is sent and the person then enters the verification code.
segment.target: The verification code is sent and the person then enters the verification code.

segment.source: After verification, the person enters and confirms new PIN.
segment.target: After verification, the person enters and confirms new PIN.

segment.source: The person can access any token-based resource using this device without being asked for credentials.
segment.target: The person can access any token-based resource using this device without being asked for credentials.

segment.source: (This work account gesture doesn't affect the device unlock PIN.)
segment.target: (This work account gesture doesn't affect the device unlock PIN.)

segment.source: Assure people that their work credentials and personal credentials are stored in separate containers; the enterprise has no access to their personal credentials.
segment.target: Assure people that their work credentials and personal credentials are stored in separate containers; the enterprise has no access to their personal credentials.

segment.source: People can go to SettingsAccountsWork or school, select the work account, and then select Unjoin to remove the account from their device.
segment.target: People can go to SettingsAccountsWork or school, select the work account, and then select Unjoin to remove the account from their device.

segment.source: Using Windows Hello and biometrics
segment.target: Using Windows Hello and biometrics

segment.source: If your policy allows it, people can add Windows Hello to their Passport.
segment.target: If your policy allows it, people can add Windows Hello to their Passport.

segment.source: Windows Hello can be fingerprint, iris, and facial recognition, and is available to users only if the hardware supports it.
segment.target: Windows Hello can be fingerprint, iris, and facial recognition, and is available to users only if the hardware supports it.

segment.source: Use a phone to sign in to a PC
segment.target: Use a phone to sign in to a PC

segment.source: If your enterprise enables phone sign-in, users can pair a phone running Windows 10 Mobile to a PC running Windows 10 and then use an app on the phone to sign in to the PC using their Microsoft Passport credentials.
segment.target: If your enterprise enables phone sign-in, users can pair a phone running Windows 10 Mobile to a PC running Windows 10 and then use an app on the phone to sign in to the PC using their Microsoft Passport credentials.

segment.source: Note: Phone sign-in is currently limited to select Technology Adoption Program (TAP) participants.
segment.target: Note: Phone sign-in is currently limited to select Technology Adoption Program (TAP) participants.

segment.source: Prerequisites:
segment.target: Prerequisites:

segment.source: The PC must be joined to the Active Directory domain or Azure AD cloud domain.
segment.target: The PC must be joined to the Active Directory domain or Azure AD cloud domain.

segment.source: The PC must have Bluetooth connectivity.
segment.target: The PC must have Bluetooth connectivity.

segment.source: The phone must be joined to the Azure AD cloud domain, or the user must have added a work account to their personal phone.
segment.target: The phone must be joined to the Azure AD cloud domain, or the user must have added a work account to their personal phone.

segment.source: The free Phone Sign-in app must be installed on the phone.
segment.target: The free Phone Sign-in app must be installed on the phone.

segment.source: Pair the PC and phone
segment.target: Pair the PC and phone

segment.source: On the PC, go to SettingsDevicesBluetooth.
segment.target: On the PC, go to SettingsDevicesBluetooth.

segment.source: Tap the name of the phone and then tap Pair to begin pairing.
segment.target: Tap the name of the phone and then tap Pair to begin pairing.

segment.source: bluetooth pairing
segment.target: bluetooth pairing

segment.source: On the phone, go to SettingsDevicesBluetooth, and verify that the passcode for Pairing accessory on the phone matches the passcode displayed on the PC, and then tap ok.
segment.target: On the phone, go to SettingsDevicesBluetooth, and verify that the passcode for Pairing accessory on the phone matches the passcode displayed on the PC, and then tap ok.

segment.target: bluetooth pairing passcode

segment.source: On the PC, tap Yes.
segment.target: On the PC, tap Yes.

segment.source: Open the Phone Sign-in app and tap the name of the PC to sign in to.
segment.target: Open the Phone Sign-in app and tap the name of the PC to sign in to.

segment.source: Note: The first time that you run the Phone-Sign app, you must add an account.
segment.target: Note: The first time that you run the Phone-Sign app, you must add an account.

segment.source: Enter the work PIN that you set up when you joined the phone to the cloud domain or added a work account.
